intro: Ophthalmophyllum spathulatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with flowers that range in color from purple to white. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Ophthalmophyllum spathulatum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
